data: GENSURG Retroperitoneal Sarcoma and Multivisceral  - Post Operative (Multiphase)
Nurse to initiate the Surgeon Immediate Post Operative phase. These orders continue on the inpatient unit
Discontinue GENSURG General Pre Operative (Day of Surgery)
QID before food and bedtime, Upon arrival to PACU
If urinary output is less than 20 mL/hr for 2 consecutive hours
T+3;0600, Remove urinary catheter on post-op day 3 (even with epidural in situ)
If PVR greater than 400 mL, PRN, Repeat up to 2 times
Chest Tube Number 1, Type Chest tube, Suction No suction, Device Pleur-Evac Sahara drainage system
Chest Tube Number 1, Type Chest tube, Suction  -20 cm H20 suction , Device Pleur-Evac Sahara drainage system

Suction: Other (see Special Instructions), Special Instructions: Other (see Special Instructions), Emergency Equipment must be with patient at all times: two non-toothed forceps for each chest tube, 250 mL bottle sterile water, Petroleum impregnated gauze
q6h, Monitor and record chest tube output Q6H
If any fluid is bypassing from drains, chest tubes or incisions
Site: Surgical Incision(s), Reinforce PRN, Leave dressings to primary closed wounds until post-op day 2
T+2;N, Site: Surgical incision(s), leave dressings to primary closed wounds until post-op day 2
Antibiotic prophylaxis is provided and completed pre-op. There is no indication to continue antibiotic prophylaxis into post-op period
20 mg, IV, q24h, drug form: inj
Incentive spirometry teaching: 10 breaths Q1 hour, while awake
Inpatient Nurse to initiate the Surgeon Post Operative (Floor) phase of this plan
Ensure follow-up appointment(s) made with Community-based services
Patient to telephone surgeon's office for follow-up appointment 2-4 weeks after discharge

Patient going home on Low Molecular Weight Heparin (enoxaparin or dalteparin). Discharge prescription may be for either enoxaparin or dalteparin for total duration of 28 days from start date of LMWH (enoxaparin or dalteparin) in hospital
Patient / family to be taught how to inject using LMWH (enoxaparin or dalteparin) (start post-op day 2) and to be given sharps container and appropriate teaching sheet
q1h for 2 hour, then q4h for 24 hour, then q6h for 24 hour, post-op day 1, then q8h for 24 hour, post-op day 2, then q12h for 24 hour, post-op day 3, then qdaily until discharge
on arrival to unit, then q4h for 48 hour, then q8h for 48 hour, then q12h for 24 hour, then qdaily until discharge
q1h for 2 hour, then  q4h for 24 hour, then q6h for 24 hours, post-op day 1, then q8h for 24 hours, post-op day 2, then q12h for 24 hours, post-op day 3, then qdaily until discharge
on arrival to unit, then  q4h for 48 hour, then q8h for 48 hours, then q12h for 24 hour, then qdaily until discharge
For a new fever greater than 38.5 DegC
Initiate ICOUGH protocol as per guideline, if applicable
Review the most current diet order for therapeutic requirements, food texture and fluid thickness. Add anything to be carried forward to the new Diet Order
